author: La Razón
title: El Papa pasa su segunda noche en el hospital y no recitará el Ángelus
text:
Vaticano
El Papa pasa su segunda noche en el hospital y no recitará el Ángelus
Se encuentra ingresado por una infección en las vías respiratorias
El Papa Francisco ha pasado su segunda noche el hospital Gemelli de Roma, donde se encuentra ingresado por una infección en las vías respiratorias, y, para facilitar su recuperación, este domingo no pronunciará la oración del Ángelus.
El pontífice, de 88 años, ha vuelto a pasar una noche tranquila, según la televisión pública RAI y la agencia Ansa, como ya sucedió en la víspera, cuando "descansó toda la noche" y "no presentó ningún episodio febril", según informó este sábado el Vaticano.
En un comunicado, la Santa Sede explicó que "para facilitar su recuperación, el personal médico le ha prescrito reposo absoluto, por lo que el Santo Padre no dirigirá la oración del Ángelus", aunque Francisco enviará el texto para su publicación.
El Vaticano señaló que las que "las pruebas realizadas durante el día confirmaron la infección de las vías respiratorias", que "la terapia se modificó ligeramente sobre la base de nuevos hallazgos microbiológicos" y que. "los exámenes de laboratorio de hoy constataron la mejora de algunos valores".
El Papa, que "recibió la Sagrada Eucaristía y luego alternó el reposo con la oración y la lectura", ha sido "informado de los numerosos mensajes de cercanía y afecto que ha recibido y expresa su gratitud, al tiempo que pide que se siga rezando por él", concluía la nota.
Francisco sufre una bronquitis persistente que en los últimos días le había imposibilitado leer algunos discursos y que finalmente obligó a hospitalizarle para someterle a exámenes diagnósticos y continuar el tratamiento.
A principios de febrero el papa explicó que sufría un "fuerte resfriado", como él mismo dijo en la audiencia general del miércoles 5 de febrero y en los días sucesivos mantuvo sus audiencias, pero en su residencia, la Casa Santa Marta, para no trasladarse al palacio pontificio "debido a una bronquitis", informó la Santa Sede.
Esta es la cuarta vez que el papa tiene que ser hospitalizado en el Gemelli.
En el pasado, el pontífice argentino ha sufrido problemas de gripe y respiratorios que incluso le obligaron a estar ingresado tres días en marzo de 2023 y en noviembre de 2023 estos problemas respiratorios le obligaron a cancelar su viaje a Dubái por la COP28.

author: sina_mobile
title: 泛舟赏花 北京5家市属公园游船开航_手机新浪网
text:
泛舟赏花 北京5家市属公园游船开航
转自：千龙网
春和景明，京城各大公园即将迎来最美赏花季节。昨天（12日）上午，陶然亭、紫竹院、玉渊潭、颐和园、北海5家市属公园游船正式开航。电动船、脚踏船、画舫、龙船等1700余条大小船只静待游客，游客可以乘船观桃红柳绿、湖光山色，享受悠闲泛舟之旅。
北海公园现有11座码头，今年公园提供10余种400余条游船供游客选择。其中，4人座与6人座的电瓶船及脚踏船能让市民游客感受驾驶的乐趣；手划船兼具趣味性和互动性，市民手摇木桨，追忆“让我们荡起双桨”的时光；摇橹船以特殊的航行方式，让游客体验“慢生活”……游客可以根据出行人数和兴趣选择船型。
玉渊潭公园有50公顷的通航水域，在即将到来的樱花文化活动期间，游客可泛舟湖上将千米樱堤的美景尽收眼底。公园共设有4座游船码头，分别位于东湖、西湖的南北两岸。在船只类型方面，公园提供丰富多样的选择，包括4人电瓶船、6人电瓶船以及4人脚踏船，还有深受小朋友欢迎的火烈鸟、海豚等卡通造型游船，总共有571条，全部启用5G游船智慧管理系统，能实现一键扫码购票、线上排队、自助叫号、扫码结算、精准定位等功能，游客乘船更便捷安全。
记者了解到，开航前市属公园对游船进行全面检修，对所有船只船体、发动机、电池等核心部件进行保养，调试管理系统，确保设备运转正常、运营安全有序。园方也呼吁广大游客，乘船时请勿离开座位或将身体探出船舱、摇晃船只，乘船禁止吸烟，下船时请带走垃圾。
为确保游客安全，根据气象部门的实时通知，遇4级或4级以上大风，公园游船将停航。公园会在官方微博及时发布停航信息，请广大游客市民及时关注，合理安排出行。

author: Howard Lloyd
title: Longevity expert says one exercise can add three years to your life - Leeds Live
text:
A scientist who looks into what makes people live longer says one 'simple hack' can add three years to your life. Dan Buettner said that walking is free, requires no prescription, and can have a dramatic impact on our longevity.
Buettner is best-known for examining Blue Zones - parts of the world where people live longer, healthier lives than any other places on earth. He said that people leading a sedentary lifestyle could add years to their lives if the simply started walking for just 20 minutes a day.
The NHS states that walking quickly can help 'build stamina, burn excess calories. and make your heart healthier'. Buettner called it a simple hack that lots of people can do, and it is understood to be a key part of the lifestyle in the Blue Zones he has studied.
He said: "There's no pill, no supplement, there's no longevity hack that has been shown to add years to your life expectancy . But there is one simple thing that people could do to get three more years, and that is if you are sedentary, if you go from zero physical activity to just 20 minutes of walking a day, it adds three years to your life expectancy. Three years!
"It's a very simple hack, it costs you nothing, and we'll see you when you're 100." He added: "If you’re sedentary and simply start walking 20 minutes a day, you can add 3 years to your life expectancy. No cost. No prescription. Just movement. This is the real longevity hack."
How many calories does walking burn?
Dr Timothy Burnett, an instructor of kinesiology at Oregon State University Cascades, says that the average person tends to burn 100 calories per mile. That means walking at a leisurely pace of 20 minutes per mile burns five calories a minute, so 100 calories per 20 minutes of walking.
A fast walk that covers a mile in 12 minutes might burn 8.3 calories per minute, so almost 100 calories over 20 minutes. However, the exact number depends on a range of factors including age and weight.
As well as being convenient, free, and easy for most of us, researchers have uncovered a range of health benefits to walking. Harvard researchers looked at 32 obesity-promoting genes in over 12,000 people and said they were cut in half if you walked for 30 minutes a day.
Research by the University of Exeter involving 78 workers showed that walking can curb your desire for sugar. It showed that, even in stressful situations, workers eat only half as much chocolate as they normally would after a 15-minute walk.
It also cuts your risk of cancer - especially breast cancer. An American Cancer Society study that zeroed in on walking found that women who walked seven or more hours a week had a 14 per cent lower risk of breast cancer than those who walked three hours or fewer per week.
Walking also reduces joint pain. It protects the joints — especially the knees and hips, which are most susceptible to osteoarthritis — by lubricating them and strengthening the muscles that support them.
Finally, it boosts your immune system. A study of over 1,000 men and women found that those who walked at least 20 minutes a day, at least 5 days a week, had 43per cent fewer sick days than those who exercised once a week or less. And if they did get sick, it was for a shorter duration, and their symptoms were milder.

author: Kevin Craft
title: Michigan receiving nearly $23 million for EV charging stations | State | abc12.com
text: FLINT, Mich. (WJRT) - The Michigan Infrastructure Office and the Michigan Department of Transportation announced that nearly $23 million has been awarded to multiple locations across Michigan for electric vehicle infrastructure. The goal of the National Electric Vehicle Infrastructure Formula Program is to increase EV accessibility for Michiganders. [Locations selected](https://www.michigan.gov/mdot/-/media/Project/Websites/MDOT/Business/Contractors/Innovative-Contracting/2023/NEVI/Round-1-Notification-of-Selection.pdf?rev=77dbb1f11ac147b3b8e5602d7b2de6c3&hash=E7ADE269C1CF92C59B92B4BFF26DAEA8) will have five years to complete their projects. Some of the projects are expected to be completed this year. The city of Flint will be getting money for two separate EV projects. Nearly $680,000 will be awarded to the Francis Energy Charging, LLC project along I-69, and more than $390,000 will be awarded to the GPM Southeast, LLC project along I-75. Alma will be receiving more than $400,000 for the GPM Southeast, LLC project along US-127. West Branch will be receiving nearly $330,000 for the Red E Charging LLC project along I-75. The money will be coming from President Biden's Bipartisan Infrastructure Law. Over the next five years, Michigan will receive about $110 million for electric vehicle infrastructure. For more information about Michigan's EV infrastructure, [visit michigan.gov.](https://www.michigan.gov/mdot/travel/mobility/initiatives/nevi)

organizations.name: national electric vehicle infrastructure formula program

author: 小浪财讯
title: 科创综指ETF国泰（589630）跌0.53%，半日成交额3946.65万元|国泰_新浪财经_新浪网
text:
6月19日，截止午间收盘，科创综指ETF国泰（589630）跌0.53%，报0.936元，成交额3946.65万元。科创综指ETF国泰（589630）重仓股方面， 海光信息 截止午盘跌0.68%， 寒武纪 涨0.31%， 中芯国际 跌0.23%， 金山办公 跌0.69%， 联影医疗 涨0.26%， 中微公司 涨0.63%， 传音控股 跌2.68%， 晶科能源 跌1.20%， 百利天恒 跌1.44%， 华润微 跌0.53%。
科创综指ETF国泰（589630）业绩比较基准为 上证科创板综合指数 收益率，管理人为国泰基金管理有限公司，基金经理为麻绎文、刘昉元，成立（2025-03-04）以来回报为-5.87%，近一个月回报为0.89%。

author: Guardian Nigeria
title: Defending champions Senegal beat Cameroon to book last-16 place | The Guardian Nigeria News - Nigeria and World News — Sport — The Guardian Nigeria News – Nigeria and World News
text: Defending champions Senegal beat Cameroon to book last-16 place Defending champions Senegal became the second qualifiers for the Africa Cup of Nations round of 16 as Ismaila Sarr, Habib Diallo and Sadio Mane scored in a 3-1 win over Cameroon on Friday. A few hours earlier, Cape Verde were the first country to secure a last-16 place by hammering Mozambique 3-0 in Abidjan. Sarr netted in the first half and Diallo and Mane in the second in Yamoussoukro to give the title-holders a maximum six points after two Group C matches. The losers have only one. Jean-Charles Castelletto scored late in the second half to halve the deficit to 2-1, but Senegal were not to be denied a convincing victory and Mane put the outcome beyond doubt. Guinea face the Gambia later in the second match of a double-header and a victory would lift them three points above Cameroon with just one round of matches remaining. Cameroon recalled Manchester United goalkeeper Andre Onana, who missed a draw with Guinea after arriving late in west Africa, but slack defending contributed to the goals he conceded. Senegal kicked off with five of the team that started the 2022 final against Egypt in Yaounde, which they won in a penalty shootout with Mane scoring the decisive spot kick. Cameroon had to do without star forward Vincent Aboubakar again as he had not recovered from a thigh injury that ruled him out of a draw with Guinea four days ago. Sarr reacts quickly More adventurous from the kick-off in the central Ivorian city, Senegal went ahead on 16 minutes through quick-reacting Sarr. After Cameroon failed twice to clear a corner, Sarr swivelled inside the box and his low shot deflected off Andre-Frank Zambo Anguissa before landing in the corner of the net. Frank Magri, the Cameroon scorer against Guinea, had a half-chance just before the half hour mark, but was beaten to a loose ball by Senegal goalkeeper Edouard Mendy. A couple of minutes later, the Sudanese referee halted play for a welcome water break with the temperature 34 Celsius (94 Fahrenheit) when the match started. Enzo Tchato rescued Cameroon as half-time approached, superbly blocking a goal-bound shot from two-time African Player of the Year Mane. A tight first half ended with just one shot on target — the goal — from three attempts by each team. Senegal increased their lead on 71 minutes with a goal born out of patience around the Cameroon penalty area. A string of short passes culminated in Sarr delivering a low cross and unmarked Diallo pushed the ball into the net from close range. Castelletto struck on 83 minutes, giving former Chelsea goalkeeper Mendy no chance with a close-range header, but hopes of snatching a draw were dashed by Mane in added time. Get the latest news delivered straight to your inbox every day of the week. Stay informed with the Guardian’s leading coverage of Nigerian and world news, business, technology and sports.

author: Abigail Gómez
title: Qué pasa si tomo moringa todos los días
text: La moringa es una de esas plantas que pueden ser consideradas como un regalo de la naturaleza, debido a que aporta un gran número de beneficios a la salud y ayudan a prevenir y combatir muchas más enfermedades que otros alimentos.

author: Get News
title: Choicese (CHC-SES) Drives Financial Digitization, Enhancing Financial Inclusion | dailytimesleader.com | Serving West Point & Clay County Since 1867
text:
In a major collaboration, Choicese (CHC-SES), the internationally renowned investment platform, has announced a strategic partnership with a leading brokerage firm to introduce stock trading services. By combining their expertise and resources, Choicese (CHC-SES) aims to provide investors with a convenient and secure stock trading platform, enabling them to participate in the stock market and embark on new investment journeys. This collaboration will further drive the development of the stock market, offering investors more options and increasing investment opportunities.
With the booming stock market, an increasing number of investors are eager to participate in stock trading, seeking the opportunities and returns it offers. To meet this demand, Choicese (CHC-SES) has partnered with a well-known brokerage firm to launch stock trading services, providing investors with a convenient and secure trading platform.
Through its collaboration with brokerage firms, Choicese (CHC-SES) has expanded its service range, enabling investors to trade stocks on the same platform. Investors can easily access the stock market through the Choicese (CHC-SES) app or online platform, executing buy and sell orders. This seamless integration offers investors a more convenient trading experience, saving time and effort.
Additionally, the collaboration with brokerage firms brings more trading tools and features to Choicese (CHC-SES). Investors can access real-time market data, stock analysis, and research reports through the Choicese (CHC-SES) trading platform, aiding them in making informed investment decisions. The platform also provides trade execution and settlement services, ensuring the security and efficiency of the transaction process.
This partnership positively impacts the development of the stock market. The global influence of Choicese (CHC-SES) combined with the brokerage firms' expertise will provide investors with more investment options and opportunities. Investors can choose stock trading strategies that suit their investment goals and risk tolerance, engaging in market fluctuations.
The introduction of stock trading services will further promote the development of the stock market, increasing market liquidity and activity. Investors will be able to invest more flexibly, seizing more investment opportunities. Choicese (CHC-SES) will continue to collaborate with brokerage firms, offering investors more comprehensive and convenient investment services, collectively fostering the prosperity and sustainable development of the stock market.
